alert.note: Alert for Bering Strait Coast; Shishmaref; St Lawrence Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 2:32PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...STRONG NORTH WINDS AND SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE OVER BERING SEA... Behind a departing low pressure system, strong northerly winds will continue into the work week through the Bering Strait and into the northern Bering Sea. Sustained winds of 25 to 30 mph and gusts to 35 mph in conjunction with on and off snow showers could lead to reduced visibiltiy to one half mile at times. Strong winds and waves could also lead to heavy freezing spray which may create light ice accumulations on surfaces. These hazardous conditions are most likely for Little Diomede and Saint Lawerence Islands. Under the heaviest snow band, a couple additional inches of snowfall are possible. North winds will strengthen again later in the week, and additional winter weather headlines may be needed for strong winds and low visibilities.

area.areaDesc: Bering Strait Coast; Shishmaref; St Lawrence Island
